user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_init:
```c
void
MHD_init (void)
{
#if defined(MHD_WINSOCK_SOCKETS)
  WSADATA wsd;
#endif /* MHD_WINSOCK_SOCKETS */

  MHD_set_panic_func (NULL, NULL);

#if defined(MHD_WINSOCK_SOCKETS)
  if (0 != WSAStartup (MAKEWORD (2, 2), &wsd))
    MHD_PANIC (_ ("Failed to initialize winsock.\n"));
  if ((2 != LOBYTE (wsd.wVersion)) && (2 != HIBYTE (wsd.wVersion)))
    MHD_PANIC (_ ("Winsock version 2.2 is not available.\n"));
#endif /* MHD_WINSOCK_SOCKETS */
#ifdef HTTPS_SUPPORT
#ifdef MHD_HTTPS_REQUIRE_GCRYPT
#if GCRYPT_VERSION_NUMBER < 0x010600
#if GNUTLS_VERSION_NUMBER <= 0x020b00
#if defined(MHD_USE_POSIX_THREADS)
  if (0 != gcry_control (GCRYCTL_SET_THREAD_CBS,
                         &gcry_threads_pthread))
    MHD_PANIC (_ ("Failed to initialise multithreading in libgcrypt.\n"));
#elif defined(MHD_W32_MUTEX_)
  if (0 != gcry_control (GCRYCTL_SET_THREAD_CBS,
                         &gcry_threads_w32))
    MHD_PANIC (_ ("Failed to initialise multithreading in libgcrypt.\n"));
#endif /* defined(MHD_W32_MUTEX_) */
#endif /* GNUTLS_VERSION_NUMBER <= 0x020b00 */
  gcry_check_version (NULL);
#else
  if (NULL == gcry_check_version ("1.6.0"))
    MHD_PANIC (_ ("libgcrypt is too old. MHD was compiled for " \
                  "libgcrypt 1.6.0 or newer.\n"));
#endif
#endif /* MHD_HTTPS_REQUIRE_GCRYPT */
  gnutls_global_init ();
#endif /* HTTPS_SUPPORT */
  MHD_monotonic_sec_counter_init ();
  MHD_send_init_static_vars_ ();
  MHD_init_mem_pools_ ();
  /* Check whether sizes were correctly detected by configure */
#ifdef _DEBUG
  if (1)
  {
    struct timeval tv;
    mhd_assert (sizeof(tv.tv_sec) == SIZEOF_STRUCT_TIMEVAL_TV_SEC);
  }
#endif /* _DEBUG */
  mhd_assert (sizeof(uint64_t) == SIZEOF_UINT64_T);
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (0 != gcry_control (GCRYCTL_SET_THREAD_CBS,
                         &gcry_threads_w32))
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 8.13 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the code passes the address expression &gcry_threads_w32 to the library call; there is no pointer declaration here that could have been const-qualified. Rule 8.13 concerns pointer types (declarations/parameters) that should be const-qualified when they do not allow modification. If gcry_control's prototype requires a non-const pointer (e.g. void *), the call is correct; if the prototype could/should be const-qualified that would be an issue in the library API, not in this call site. A true MISRA 8.13 violation would be declaring a pointer variable or function parameter in this translation unit as non-const when it could be const (for example, using "void *p = &gcry_threads_w32;" when "const void *p" would suffice).
